e: little one, son, daughter, of any age - also used informally to adults much like "lads" or "guys"

Kids like to tease younger children.

e: living tissue - meat, muscle, flesh - animal or human, "flesh and blood"

e: clan of purpose (as opposed to family)

Deceiving your enemy is half the battle.

e: music of war, rhythmic sound of constant cannon fire (poetic)
lion (extinct animal, now used for a someone who is always on the frontline)
The War of Life and Death (Mandalorian myth)
hard contact, engagement in combat with an enemy
to summon, to call forward, to find and bring back
summons, invitation, request for a meeting
meeting of the clans (the closest thing to a government or parliament, lit. clan of clans)
reputation (of a clan, not a person)
duty; actions required of individual as part of a team or clan

pen, pencil; any tool to write with
expression of being angry, repelled or *That really ticks me off.* From the words for give and a hated thing, much like *it gives me the scunners.*

to succeed, get the upper hand

e: to beat rhythmically - like a drum or heartbeat

alarm, siren; a call to arms
pint of ale - contents of helmet, actually a lot more than a pint!

to "put the boot in"; to act cruelly towards someone

e: rough as a strill's backside - phrase used to describe a bar that's a dive, an uncultured individual (by Mando standards) or a very violent, dangerous neighbourhood
rough, unruly, of the criminal underclass (by Mando standards, which is very rough indeed)
corpse robber, thief, petty criminal - general term of abuse
rotten, low-life, - generic adjective to describe an undesirable person of dubious ethics
to tease, barrack, make fun of (not as hostile as mock)

Examples.eng: Kids like to tease younger children.

e: fresh start, clean slate (lit. white field, virgin snow) - term indicating the erasing of a person's past when they become Mandalorian, and that they will only be judged by what they do from that point onwards; like the "first turn of the screw cancels all debts" for sailors
to fence, launder - of stolen goods, etc
Are you looking for a smack in the face, mate?

Examples.eng: I want revenge for this incursion!

Examples.mandoa: Ni copaani dinuir murecye par riduur.
Examples.eng: I want to give my wife a kiss.

e: charming, cute (babies and animals - never women unless you want your head ripped off)
attractive (not looks - generally appealing, separate concept for Mandos - and may refer to anything)
Indoor game that involves stabbing blades into a chequered board - a cross between darts, chess and ludo

Examples.eng: Why did you break our contract?
Our target are six jedi.

e: It's neither here nor there. *It's irrelevant.*
Mandalorian instructors recruited to train the clones (lit. Those who no longer exist)

e: code used by Mandalorians, like Morse

e: no longer a parent (legal term - parental divorce by child)
a state of not being Mandalorian - not an outsider, but one who has lost his heritage, and so his identity and his soul - regarded with absolute dread by most traditionally-minded Mando'ade

someone who commits atrocities, a real-life monster, a war criminal - from the notorious Mandalorian scientist of the Old Republic, Demagol, known for his experiments on children, and a figure of hate and dread in the Mando psyche
idiot, useless individual, waste of space (lit. someone who forgets to put their pants on)
sitrep, wash-up, any sharing of information and planning (military, also used colloquially)

Examples.mandoa: Tion gar vurel din'waada gar tracy'uur?

m: Gar shuk meh kyrayc. (Meh gar kyrayc, shuk bah ni.)
e: You're no use dead. (You're no use to me dead.) Said to encourage someone to take a rest. Rarely literal.
p: [gar SHOOK may kee-RAYSH (may gar kee-RAYSH, BAH ni SHOOK)]

m: Gar taldin ni jaon'yc; gar sa buir, ori'wadaasla.
e: *Nobody cares who your parent was, only the parent you'll be.* (lit. Bloodline is not important, but you as a parent are the most valuable thing.) Mando saying emphasizing the importance of a parent's role, and that a parent is judged more by that than their lineage.
p: [gar tahl-DEEN nee jai-ON-eesh, gar sa boo-EER OH-ree-wah-DAHS-lah]

bandit, villain, petty thief - can also mean a serious criminal you have no respect for - abusive

e: eccentric, cranky, in a mood (lit. almost insane)
almost, roughly (before a vowel, cf. ge)

e: Team game similar to meshgeroya, in that there are goals at either end of the pitch, except the players may handle the ball. Very similar to rugby; brutal, fast and painful.
dried fish-meal (like pemmican - lasts for years but very pungent smell)

e: the - definite article, rare and emphatic

parchment bread. Mando ration-pack staple. A thin sheet of bread, dried to preserve it and reconstituted in liquid. Made properly, it's so thin you can almost read through it, hence the name "see-bread."
dried blood, scab (also a term for a lasting emotional scar)
Mando saying - Many a true word spoken in jest. (lit. there's truth in all jokes.)
Truth, honor, vision - words used to seal a pact.

m: Haatyc or'arue jate'shya ori'sol aru'ike nuhaatyc.
e: Better one big enemy that you can see than many small ones that you can't. (Mandalorian proverb.)
Tuck in! Enjoy! (lit. Fill your boots.)
"noseburn" - burning sensation in the sinuses brought about by specific spices - Mandalorians prize this
spicy, as in makes the sinuses burn (a sensation like eating horseradish or wasabi)

Examples.eng: Mandalorians like spicy food.
We barely escaped the burning city.

e: "mouthburn" - a sought-after state of intense burning in the mouth brought about by very spicy food - see also hetikleyc

stupidly oblivious of danger, asking for it
to recklessly risk your life, act suicidally (negative connotation - foolish, not brave)
death wish, insane act of reckless stupidity
luck, destiny (lit. good stars, a course to steer by)
good mood - a complex sense of being at one with your clan and life
sir, madam, distinguished guest - used by bar staff, etc. and not used by the military

e: chef, someone who prepares food for eating
to stab with a narrow blade ("skewer")
to hold in the heart forever - the Mandalorian equivalent of "to love"
to know, hold in the heart
main living room of a traditional Mandalorian house - a single big chamber for eating, talking, resting, and even the last secure stronghold when under attack
He loves his food. (Said of someone who has a healthy appetite, using the verb for affection rather than enjoyment.)
He's an idiot (lit. his brain cell is lonely)

discovery, something found at last, a state of heaven

e: How are you? (lit. what's new with you?) Can also be used to ask a soldier for a sitrep. If a Mando asks you this, they expect an answer; it's literal. The response for *I'm fine thanks,* is *Naas.* (lit. nothing.)
Huh? What? Expression of bewilderment or disbelief
which, what, that, who (before a consonant, cf. megin)

commando state of mind - an attitude that he/she can do anything, endure anything, and achieve the objective. A blend of complete confidence and extreme tenacity instilled in special forces during training. Can also be used informally to describe a determined, focused person.

Examples.eng: Always act with a plan!
Our target is six jedi.

e: Six Actions, the tenets of Mando life
just in case (colloquial - Mandos are cautious and always have a plan B)

Examples.mandoa: Ni copaani dinuir murecye par riduur.
Examples.eng: I want to give my wife a kiss.

e: love bond, specifically between spouses - marriage agreement

Examples.eng: A purposeful defeat can deceive an army.
Conquer your fear, and build strength.

Examples.mandoa: Ke goora mirshe. Ra ruuse, a ke serim.
Examples.eng: Throw brains. Or rocks, but be accurate.
Mandalorians head-butt to kiss.

Examples.mandoa: Ke goora mirshe. Ra ruuse, a ke serim.
Examples.eng: Throw brains. Or rocks, but be accurate.

e: to be right, to be accurate
cease-fire, truce (from the practice of sitting down at a table with refreshments to talk terms, as in the same term for *over a meal*)
over a meal, at the dinner table, like the French *au table* - the word for table comes from the word for level, flat, so the implication is one of equals breaking bread together
to mess with - very strong language in Mando'a, so use only in extreme circumstances
botty, tush (diminutive of shebs) - kids' word but sometimes used ironically or in humour
backside, rear, buttocks (also rear of building etc)

lust for life and much more - uniquely Mandalorian word, meaning the enjoyment of each day and the determination to seek and grab every possible experience, as well as surviving to see the next day - hanging onto life and relishing it. An understandable state of mind for a warrior people. Closely related to the words for live, hunt and stay safe - and, of course *oya*. All from the same root.

Examples.eng: Don't worry, it's only a scratch.

e: beverage - any infusion of whatever's available, but usually a mildly stimulant herb with a citrus flavor called behot
crushed or ground nut (topping or ingredient for uj)
not working, no use, useless, broken down, out of order - usually said of machinery
to crush (in any sense), to conquer

Examples.eng: Why did you break our contract?

e: settling scores, revenge, feud (different to vengeance - more personal)

Examples.eng: I want revenge for this incursion!
Long memory, short fuse.
Mandalorians like spicy food.

Examples.mandoa: Meg skraan nu draluram, ni n'epa.
Examples.eng: If the food is not vivid, I don't eat it.

e: assorted small snacks like meze or tapas - *small eats* - a celebratory meal for Mandos because it can take hours to eat, and the dishes are often fiddly, a contrast to the easy-to-eat, quick meals necessary in the field
united, as one; individual, alone, vulnerable; each
Contemptuous and triumphant comment - like *suck on that, chum!*
strill - highly intelligent six-legged hunting carnivore, capable of gliding and flight

Examples.eng: The bounty hunter tracked his target far.

e: to keep an eye on, monitor

e: the state of blissful rest and peace

e: deceased, passed on (lit. marched far away)
to sweat blood, to *give blood* - idiom for going that extra mile or making an all-out effort

e: Got it? Okay? Understand? (Often very aggressive.)

e: alcoholic drink - strong clear spirit made from fruit, like eau de vie
interrogative particle, used for a question

e: Who's that? (often used as a challenge to identify someone - like *Halt! Who goes there?*

e: to man, staff, form the strength of, represent

uj cake - dense, very sweet flat cake made of ground nuts, syrup, pureed dried fruit and spice
thick scented syrup used in cooking
forced to make a decision (lit. when push comes to shove)
to care, take notice of; to detect

Outsiders believe all Mandalorians are rude.

e: Go away! (Very rude - from same root as osik)

May this happen, I wish (prefixes statement)

e: A warrior is bigger than the armor (Mandalorian proverb)
private (rank) Can be used affectionately, often to a child; *little soldier* - context is critical.
large evergreen tree with a grain similar to Earth oak
temporary hut made of wattle and daub, a *basha*
plain, fields - open, flat or gently rolling land
sibling, brother, sister; comrade, close mate
Thank you (lit. I accept a debt)

e: Good grief! General exclamation of surprise, good or bad.
It was ages ago. - colloquial, often used as *Forget it* or *It doesn't matter*

Examples.eng: This attack is totally stealthy.

e: *richly nourishing* - peculiarly Mandalorian description of dense, high-calorie food, of great importance to people dependent on highly portable field rations
comfortable, familiar, sense of *at home*. Can also mean local to the speaker.
